articles.author: Leticia Miranda
articles.title: Coronavirus challenges $45 billion cruise industry
articles.description: Coronavirus concerns pushed the $45 billion cruise line industry to cancel trips and reroute ships to contain  impact from the outbreak and fearful travelers.
articles.content:
Coronavirus concerns have pushed the $45 billion cruise line industry to cancel trips and reroute ships as it struggles to contain the impact from fearful travelers. But experts say the industry will bounce back after the outbreak is contained.

articles.title: Lockdowns to curb coronavirus epidemic lead to a rise in mental health issues
articles.description: Government-enforced moves to deal with coronavirus outbreak are forcing millions of Chinese people to deal with the emotional and psychological fallout.
articles.content:
BEIJING Zhang Meng, a college student from Changchun, in Chinas eastern Jilin province, was concerned that her sudden weight loss was related to fear and anxiety over the coronavirus outbreak sweeping the country.

articles.title: Feds' plan to relocate coronavirus patients puts region at risk, California city says
articles.description: Officials in Costa Mesa, California, and Anniston, Alabama, said they received little notice of plans to transfer coronavirus patients to their cities.
